snippet.title: Swift: AppStore - Perform Segue In Code or Programmatically (Ep 4)
snippet.description:
For the API calls, please use these two links:
https://api.letsbuildthatapp.com/appstore/featured
https://api.letsbuildthatapp.com/appstore/appdetail

Twitter Slide Out Menu Course
https://www.letsbuildthatapp.com/course/Twitter-Slide-Out-Menu

Podcasts Course
https://www.letsbuildthatapp.com/course/Podcasts

Intermediate Training Core Data
https://www.letsbuildthatapp.com/course/intermediate-training-core-data

Instagram Firebase Course
https://www.letsbuildthatapp.com/course/instagram-firebase

Facebook Group
https://www.facebook.com/groups/1240636442694543/

Today we learn how to perform a segue programmatically in code by manually pushing a view controller onto the navigational stack.  Along with this, we'll be carrying over the specific App data onto this new controller to show its details.
 
Source Code:
https://www.letsbuildthatapp.com/course/AppStore

Make sure to watch the other parts of this series if you're interested in building out the app from scratch (perhaps show your friends!):

(Part 1) Recreating the App Store: https://youtu.be/Ko9oNhlTwH0
(Part 2) Integrating REST API: https://youtu.be/uLb8cs11h_g
(Part 3) Headers and Cell Subclassing

Twitter: twitter.com/buildthatapp
